Summary: In response to: WAY Brighter and Bigger than Venus! Star-like, but way too big to be a satellite moving. Are we seeing Nebuae?
divs: sighting detailsa few days ago it was reported there was a ring around the sun. searching this out on the net i found this was not the first instance as they have been seeing this for a few years in various areas. i realized a star when it becomes unstable and dying will exhibit these same attributes. it will also emit nebulae which will appear red and blue. our sun is a medium size star. i copied the following as this isn���t supposed to happen for 10,000 years. but reading stories and viewing the many pictures on mufon it appears to be happening now. accordingly this is what i copied from the net: as we viewed our home galaxy, the milky way, we would see these "planetary", or ejection nebulae flaring and fading all the time, about one per earth year, much as the flashes of cameras at a sports stadium at night. at any given instant more than 10,000 nebulae are visible in some stage of their evolution. planetary nebulae make the milky way come alive. from afar the milky way would resemble a scintillating galactic christmas tree. a red flash appears here, and another there, as planetary nebulae form. for a few thousand years each nebula brightens and turns from red to green. thanks, bonnie bell www.welcome2armageddon.com\
